title: The TVLine-Up: What’s Returning, New and Leaving the Week of Feb. 2
description: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or […]
author: Ryan Schwartz
excerpt: On TV this Week: 'NCIS: Sydney,' 'Sweet Magnolias' and 'Wild Cards' return with new seasons, while '9-1-1: Lone Star' and 'Harlem' come to an end.
text: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll. This week, you’ll find eight returning series (including NCIS: Sydney, Sweet Magnolias and Wild Cards), seven series debuts (including Lauren Graham in The Z-Suite, Laverne Cox in Clean Slate and Kaitlyn Dever in Apple Cider Vinegar) and nine finales (including the very last episodes of 9-1-1: Lone Star and Harlem). first three episodes)3 am The Kardashians Season 6 premiere (Hulu)3 am Sweet Magnolias Season 4 premiere (Netflix; all 10 episodes)3 am The Z-Suite series premiere (Tubi; first two episodes)8 pm Hell’s Kitchen Season 23 finale (Fox)9 pm NFL Honors (Fox) FRIDAY, FEB. 73 am The Lion King at the Hollywood Bowl concert special (Disney+)3 am Piece by Piece streaming premiere (Peacock)3 am Pokémon Horizons: The Series Part 5 premiere (Netflix)3 am We Live in Time streaming premiere (Max)7 pm Critics Choice Awards (E!)8 pm NCIS: Sydney Season 2 premiere (CBS)8:30 pm Lopez vs. Lopez Season 3 finale (NBC)10 pm NFL Icons Season 4 finale (MGM+) SATURDAY, FEB. 83 am Yellowstone to Yosemite With Kevin Costner docuseries premiere (Fox Nation)8 pm The ’90s Boy Band Boom documentary premiere (The CW)8 pm Super Bowl Soulful Celebration special (Fox)9 pm Kobe: The Making of a Legend docuseries finale (CNN) Want scoop on any of the above shows? html:
This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch column, our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming, and our master list of Every New TV Show Premiering in 2025.

With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll.

This week, you’ll find eight returning series (including NCIS: Sydney, Sweet Magnolias and Wild Cards), seven series debuts (including Lauren Graham in The Z-Suite, Laverne Cox in Clean Slate and Kaitlyn Dever in Apple Cider Vinegar) and nine finales (including the very last episodes of 9-1-1: Lone Star and Harlem).

SUNDAY, FEB. 2
3 pm NFL Pro Bowl Games (ABC/ESPN)
8 pm Grammys (CBS)
8 pm Worst Cooks in America Season 28 finale (Food Network; two episodes)
10 pm Funny Woman Season 2 premiere (PBS)

MONDAY, FEB. 3
3 am The Great American Baking Show: Celebrity Big Game special (The Roku Channel)
8 pm Below Deck Down Under Season 3 premiere (Bravo)
8 pm The Voice Season 27 premiere (NBC)
8 pm 9-1-1: Lone Star series finale (Fox)
9 pm Celebrity IOU Season 9 premiere (HGTV)

TUESDAY, FEB. 4
3 am Burden of Guilt docuseries premiere (Paramount+; all three episodes)
3 am Wicked Game: Devil in the Desert docuseries premiere (Hulu; all three episodes)
9 pm The Real Housewives of New York City Reunion, Part 2 of 2 (Bravo)

WEDNESDAY, FEB. 5
3 am Celebrity Bear Hunt series premiere (Netflix; all eight episodes)
3 am Kinda Pregnant movie premiere (Netflix)
8 pm The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City Reunion, Part 3 of 3 (Bravo)
8 pm Special Forces: World’s Toughest Test Season 3 finale (Fox)
8 pm Wild Cards Season 2 premiere (The CW)
9 pm Super Bowl Greatest Commercials special (CBS)
10 pm Life Interrupted: Isabella Strahan’s Fight Against Cancer special (ABC)

THURSDAY, FEB. 6
3 am Apple Cider Vinegar limited series premiere (Netflix; all six episodes)
3 am Clean Slate series premiere (Prime Video; all eight episodes)
3 am Death Without Mercy documentary premiere (Paramount+)
3 am Harlem series finale (Prime Video; two episodes)
3 am Here Come the Irish docuseries finale (Peacock)
3 am Invincible Season 3 premiere (Prime Video; first three episodes)
3 am The Kardashians Season 6 premiere (Hulu)
3 am Sweet Magnolias Season 4 premiere (Netflix; all 10 episodes)
3 am The Z-Suite series premiere (Tubi; first two episodes)
8 pm Hell’s Kitchen Season 23 finale (Fox)
9 pm NFL Honors (Fox)

FRIDAY, FEB. 7
3 am The Lion King at the Hollywood Bowl concert special (Disney+)
3 am Piece by Piece streaming premiere (Peacock)
3 am Pokémon Horizons: The Series Part 5 premiere (Netflix)
3 am We Live in Time streaming premiere (Max)
7 pm Critics Choice Awards (E!)
8 pm NCIS: Sydney Season 2 premiere (CBS)
8:30 pm Lopez vs. Lopez Season 3 finale (NBC)
10 pm NFL Icons Season 4 finale (MGM+)

SATURDAY, FEB. 8
3 am Yellowstone to Yosemite With Kevin Costner docuseries premiere (Fox Nation)
8 pm The ’90s Boy Band Boom documentary premiere (The CW)
8 pm Super Bowl Soulful Celebration special (Fox)
9 pm Kobe: The Making of a Legend docuseries finale (CNN)

Want scoop on any of the above shows? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line.

January Streaming Guide: 80+ Premieres!
